body_html:
This is most likely because you chose to say
sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True, num_tokens=0)

instead of
sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True)

with the default value of num_tokens = -1.

Is the exception still raised for you when you revert num_tokens? Would it work for you to keep the default as-is?
body_text:
This is most likely because you chose to say
sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True, num_tokens=0)
instead of
sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True)
with the default value of num_tokens = -1.
Is the exception still raised for you when you revert num_tokens?  Would it work for you to keep the default as-is?
body:
This is most likely because you chose to say
`sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True, num_tokens=0)`

instead of
`sync_hook = opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief=True)`

with [the default value of num_tokens = -1](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/python/training/sync_replicas_optimizer.py#L432).

Is the exception still raised for you when you revert num_tokens?  Would it work for you to keep the default as-is?
